channel.title: How to compile a server for online usage
channel.description:
Hello guys, Thank's for reading this!
I could really do with alittle help on how to compile the server so that it can be used online.
I have the server, And the client.
What do i need to compile, And How do i go around doing this, Once that has done how do i insert the java compile into a html/php etc etc..

item.title: How to compile a server for online usage
item.dc:creator: @html33 html33
item.description:
@html33 wrote:

Alright i’ll try that out although it seems very veage.

Would somone mind going through a “Step by step” with me

Edit, I cannot seem to even find that compile option. Elaborate for me please.

Side note; I have installed Jdk 6[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2008, 01:25:26 pm[/size][hr]BUMP HURAH!

Read full topic
item.source: How to compile a server for online usage

item.title: How to compile a server for online usage
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

To use java/javac from PHP you can use PHP’s exec() function. More info here: http://ca.php.net/manual/en/function.exec.php
JDK’s bin will have to be in your path, however. Also, if you start a server using exec(), use javaw, not java, to start it in the background.

Read full topic
item.source: How to compile a server for online usage

item.title: How to compile a server for online usage
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

Install Jdk6

Route it (right click compiler -> set path)

Done.
Usually in C:// in the java folder
